intro: Stichorkis tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
